The Remington Typewriter Company has a rich history, and the Noiseless Portable is an important part of it.

**Remington Typewriter Company History:**

The Remington Typewriter Company was founded in 1873 by Philo Remington, a gun manufacturer, in Ilion, New York. Remington was the first company to mass-produce typewriters, and they quickly became a leading manufacturer of writing machines. In the late 1800s, Remington introduced the first portable typewriter, the Remington No. 1, which was a significant innovation in typing technology.

Throughout the early 20th century, Remington continued to innovate and expand their product line. They introduced the Noiseless Portable in the 1920s, which became a popular model among writers and professionals.

**Development of the Remington Noiseless Portable:**

The Remington Noiseless Portable was designed to address the growing demand for portable typewriters. In the 1920s, many writers and professionals needed a reliable, compact, and quiet writing machine that could be used in various settings. Remington's Noiseless Portable was a response to this demand.

The Noiseless Portable featured a unique noise-reducing mechanism, which utilized a series of levers and springs to dampen the sound of the keys striking the platen. This innovation made the machine much quieter than its predecessors, earning it the "Noiseless" moniker.

The Remington Noiseless Portable was also designed to be lightweight and compact, making it easy to transport. It was marketed as a high-quality, reliable writing machine suitable for professionals, students, and travelers.
